alert.note: Alert for Eastern Douglas County Foothills (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 10 at 3:57PM PST until January 11 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST THURSDAY ABOVE 2500 FEET... * WHAT...Moderate snow showers above 2500 feet occurring. Additional snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches. The highest terrain will see up to 14 inches. * WHERE...The foothills of the Cascades in Douglas County, above 2500 feet, including Steamboat, Toketee Falls, and upper portions of highway 138. * WHEN...Until 10 PM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow showers will continue below 2500 feet, but they are not expected to contribute to significant impacts. In addition, another system will arrive later this week and have the potential to bring significant snowfall to the higher elevations in the area. More information to come. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
